intro: Faramea calimana, commonly known as the white-veined faramea, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves with prominent white veins. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Faramea calimana is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique appearance.
